data.title: State police arrest convicted felon involved in road rage incident during 'high-risk stop'
data.meta_description: Oregon State Police arrested a Gresham man in Lane County on charges includingFelon in Possession of a Firearm. Just after 4 p. m. Thursday (Sept. 23, 2021), members of OSP's Springfield Area Command received a menacing complaint on I-5 near milepost 189.  Troopers were advised that two vehicles were involved in a road rage incident and one of the motorists pointed a firearm at the victim vehicle during the incident.
data.text:
Oregon State Police arrested a Gresham man in Lane County on charges includingFelon in Possession of a Firearm.

Just after 4 p.m. Thursday (Sept. 23, 2021), members of OSP's Springfield Area Command received a menacing complaint on I-5 near milepost 189.

Troopers were advised that two vehicles were involved in a road rage incident and one of the motorists pointed a firearm at the victim vehicle during the incident.

Troopers were able to stop the vehicle on I-5 northbound near milepost 205, where "a high-risk stop was initiated," OSP said.

The driver, identified as Roger Dale Brown Jr., 39, of Gresham,was taken into custody without incident.

"The driver was found to be a convicted felon," OSP said. "During a search of the vehicle, troopers located four more weapons, two 45cal semi-auto pistols, a 308cal SCAR Assault rifle, and a pistol style AK47 with a 75-round drum."

Police say all weapons were loaded with bullets in the chambers and a heavy ballistic vest with rifle-rated plates in it.

There was also a seizure of approximately $60,000.

Brown was transported to the Lane County Jail where he was lodged for:
